column5: Did the trek into the Eastern townships again this past weekend to visit my buddies father in-laws private lake and lodge. WOW.....what a fantastic time (beer). Headed up Saturday morning and arrived around noon. No motors allowed so it was oars and paddles (beer) on this probably 3 sq-mile lake. I opted for a Showbee 6wt with a wt forward floating line and a 4.5lb tippet. I moved back and forth between a Mickey finn and another yellow red and black fly that the name escapes me at this time, while others preferred the spinning outfits. While they did catch a bit more fish, the fun factor was explosive on the fly rod. There was about 35 fish caught between me and my bud over the 2 days. (beer)   Most were returned to the water but some were pretty tasty.  The lodge has a history going back almost 150 years and listening to some of the historians was as good as fishing itself. The lodge was a frozen in time museum of the past. It was awesome (beer)   And of course with ice of last Wednesday, it was a perfect time for a dip (beer)    I have a good batch soaking right now that will hit the smoker tomorrow! (beer)  What a great trip!
A nice hidden gem you had offered up Matt.  As for the dip,I,ll wait a few weeks.LOL   Thanks for sharing.
Does your buddy need any new buddies?  Sounds like a heck of a weekend, very cool.
Does your buddy need any new buddies?  Sounds like a heck of a weekend, very cool. Lotto 649 would be nice so I could have my own lake lol
One of the guys had a drone, it was awesome! Got some amazing pics with it. Watched it go almost out of sight straight up from us then zoom in at an amazing pace. Here's the gang on the dock!
Ohhh yeah.  I just got my fly rods rigged up for next week's brookie adventures (beer)!  looks like an awesome trip (beer)
I just can't believe you found that many Sens fans to go fishing with..... Looks like a great outing Matt... how long is the lake??
That's a weekend anyone would want to have.  ALL THOSE Brookies and beer... WHOA!  Good stuff bud.
Can I be your friend?  Beer & fishing!  Awesome!
Can a closet Leaf fan come with you the next time if I promise to seek professional help??

I just can't believe you found that many Sens fans to go fishing with..... Looks like a great outing Matt... how long is the lake?? Actually, I was a lone Sens fan in a sea of Habs fans. I took a bit of ribbing! lol  The lake was about a mile long, maybe 1.3 max. and about the same width.
Can a closet Leaf fan come with you the next time if I promise to seek professional help??  Too funny!
Into the smoker you go little candy!      Gonna be yummy!
Cool.  Fly fishing is the best, especially when you get into good size fish.  I use my 4-5 wt with 9ft tippets for this kind of fishing.
